alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 4:59PM MDT until August 23 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN LARIMER COUNTY... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain showers will continue through the warned area. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas, including Beaver Creek and Fish Creek. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... central portions of Cameron Peak burn scar, just northwest of Pingree Park. This includes the following additional locations... Sky Ranch. Local authorities have not reported any flash flooding at this time. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
